div.ab: zōt ud rāspīg sastica, zōt vaṇtāca... vid. Nērangs; Anklesaria, Geldner.

RecitationInstruction.ab: VrS15.1a sastica vaṇtāca rafnaŋhāca...] vaṇtāca rafnaŋhāca viϑušaēibiiasca zaoϑrābiiō OD yeŋ́hē mē (VrS15.2) 2065, 2070.

Nerangs.ab: zōt ud rāspīg harw dō sastica guftan barsom gušādan ud grih andak-ē šust kardan barsom hōy ud dašn paydāg kardan ud datuš †ēw- tāg ī stabrtar ud rāsttar abar abrāštan ud abar barsomdān bastan vaṇtāca. ...

"The zōt and the rāspīg, both, should recite sasti. He should loose the barsom, make the knot a bit slack***/ wash a bit the knot, show the left and the right side of the barsom, raise the strongest and straightest twig as datuš and tie it to the barsomdān (and then continue with) vaṇtāca. ..."

sastica. zōt ud rāspīg harw dō bē gōwišn barsom az barsomdān ul stānišn bē dō nēm abāz kunišn hašt pad dōgānag-ē az dašn ōšmurdan ēk tāg rāsttar ud stabrtar pad datuš kunišn ud bē abrāzēnišn ud barsom ō ī māhrōy bandišn dast abar barsom nihišn guftan vaṇtāca... daēnaiiā̊ vaŋhuiiā̊ māzdaiiasnōiš skūrag abāz rāst kunišn ǰīv bē baxšišn

"Both, the zōt and the rāspīg have to recite sastica. (The zōt) has to take the barsom from the barsomdān and divide it into two halves. He should count eight pairs from the right side. He should make one twig that is the straightest and the strongest to datuš and he has to raise it and to tie the barsom to the māhrōy and put his hand on the barsom. He should recite vaṇtāca ... daēnaiiā̊ vaŋhuiiā̊ māzdaiiasnōiš. He has to turn up again the (inverted) skūrag and distribute ǰīwām (into the skūrag)"

sastica. zōt ud rāspīg harw dō bē gōwišn barsom abar gīrišn barsom dašn ud hōy paydāg bē kunišn bē dō nēm abāz kunišn hašt pad dōgānag-ē az dašn ōšmurdan ēk tāg rāsttar ud stabrtar pad datuš kunišn ud bē abrāzēnišn ud barsom ō ī māhrōy bandišn dast abar barsom nihišn guftan vaṇtāca ... daēnaiiā̊ vaŋhuiiā̊ māzdaiiasnōiš skūrag abāz rāst kunišn ǰīw abāz baxšišn

"Both, the zōt and the rāspīg have to recite sastica. (The zōt) has to take the barsom, show the right and left sides and divide it into two halves. He should count eight pairs from the right side. He should make one twig that is the straightest and the strongest to datuš and he has to raise it and to tie the barsom to the māhrōy and put his hand on the barsom. He should recite vaṇtāca ... daēnaiiā̊ vaŋhuiiā̊ māzdaiiasnōiš. He has to turn up again the (inverted) skūrag and distribute ǰīwām (into the skūrag)."
"Between sastica and vaṇtāca, he has to raise the datuš."
